text:
Today, I introduced the Endometriosis CARE Act to advance endometriosis research, develop and expand access to treatments, and promote public awareness.  

We must make progress in research and education to effectively treat and support women affected by endometriosis.

Despite the significant impact of endometriosis on the lives of women who are affected by it, our society has overlooked women’s pain and ignored the stigma surrounding menstrual issues. https://t.co/0sdhzoKBoe

Today, I visited the White House for a bill signing ceremony for a bill I co-led! 

@POTUS signed into law the Veterans Rapid Retraining Assistance Program Restoration Act, which will protect student veterans from predatory schools and could help more than 300 Illinois veterans! https://t.co/PfwRS9yHjS

I was fortunate to host a Veterans Pinning Ceremony to honor Vietnam-era veterans in our community for their service to our country. We must recognize how much they’ve sacrificed to keep our country safe. https://t.co/1KUvKHlZUF

The U.S. ranks last among high-income countries for maternal health outcomes. As a co-founder and co-chair of the Black Maternal Health Caucus, I’m working to end disparities in maternal mortality and save moms’ lives.

Menthol masks the harshness of smoking and makes it easier for kids to start smoking and ultimately get addicted. 

I support @US_FDA’s efforts to eliminate menthol cigarettes and protect future generations from addiction — we must end this cycle.

The economy is adding good jobs at a record pace, but we need to continue to find ways to bring costs down for working families. 

The COMPETES Act — which I voted to pass the House — would bolster our manufacturing power and address supply chain disruptions.
Enough is enough. We must enact commonsense, life-saving legislation passed by the House last year to end our country’s gun violence crisis and protect children and educators at school.

We must advance evidence-based solutions, like my Black Maternal Health Momnibus Act, to end maternal mortality, so that Black moms don't approach motherhood with fear and dread.

We can transform our maternity care system so everyone can experience joyful parenthood.

I’m hearing more than ever before from parents, students, and educators about the urgent need for mental health support in schools. 

I secured $111 million, an almost 700% increase, for school-based mental health programs so young people have the tools they need to thrive.

I held Big Oil companies accountable for their price gouging — deliberately keeping production low and gas prices high — by voting to pass the Consumer Fuel Price Gouging Prevention Act.  

This legislation would go after price gouging and provide relief to working families.

As we recover from the pandemic, families are experiencing pain at the pump and making tough decisions when it comes to their household budgets. I’m dedicated to lowering costs and fighting inflation for working families. Learn more about my work here: https://t.co/SKoWyc2vvp.

Semiconductors are chips that help our everyday electronics work — like phones, computers, and appliances. 

The COMPETES Act, which I voted for and passed the House, would increase domestic production of semiconductors and reduce supply chain disruptions. https://t.co/JHJLtgKdgL

Health care is a human right. 

I believe that every person in this country deserves access to affordable, high-quality health care, and it’s this belief that drives me and motivates my work every day.

Providers have offered courage, compassion, and high-quality care to patients and their families across the country. 

That’s why I co-sponsored @RepEscobar’s Healthcare Providers Safety Act, which provides grants to health providers to improve their physical and cybersecurity.

As a nurse, I am committed to standing up for health care providers.

As we see more radical measures attacking access to essential health care, we know there’s one group of providers that face greater threats: abortion and reproductive health care providers.

Happy #PrideMonth! This month and every month, we celebrate the LGBTQ+ community. As a member of the @LGBTEqCaucus, I pledge to fight for equality in Congress and in my community. https://t.co/9aBS0fItdt
